com.orchestranetworks.d3
Interface NodeMonitoring

public interface NodeMonitoring

Listener interface that runs on a slave node to perform specific actions when the slave status switches to the states 'Available' or 'Unavailable'.

Using node monitoring

  1. Create a class that implements this interface. This class must not be in an EBX5 module and must be accessible from the class-loader of ebx.jar.
  2. Go to 'Administration > [D3] Slave configuration' in the user interface and set the full class name in the field /root/slave/monitoringClass.
  3. Click outside the text field to run class validation. If nothing happens, the validation has succeeded. Otherwise, an error message is displayed.

See Slave monitoring through the Java API for more information.

Since:
5.4.0

Method Summary
 void handleWhenDown(NodeMonitoringContext aContext)
          This method is triggered when the slave's status changes to 'Unavailable'.
 void handleWhenUp(NodeMonitoringContext aContext)
          This method is triggered when the slave's status changes to 'Available'.
 

Method Detail

handleWhenUp

void handleWhenUp(NodeMonitoringContext aContext)
This method is triggered when the slave's status changes to 'Available'. This happens when the initialization operation succeeds.

If the execution of this method throws an exception, its stack trace will be added to the D3 logger and the error will have no other impact.

handleWhenDown

void handleWhenDown(NodeMonitoringContext aContext)
This method is triggered when the slave's status changes to 'Unavailable'. This happens when:
  • The slave receives a deactivation request from the master.
  • The slave EBX5 instance shuts down.
  • The slave administrator launches the Unregister service from the user interface under '[D3] Slave configuration'.

If the execution of this method throws an exception, its stack trace will be added to the D3 logger and the error will have no other impact.
